title: 111_hr3722
content:
The Act titled "Enhanced New Markets and Expanded Investment in Renewable Energy for Small Manufacturers Act of 2009" expands the New Markets Venture Capital Program and requires the Administrator of the Small Business Administration to submit a report to Congress on any program expansions within a year of the Act's enactment. SEC. 102 of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to promote nationwide distribution by selecting companies from each geographic region. SEC. 103 focuses on increasing investment in small manufacturing businesses. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to promote the growth of small businesses in low-income geographic areas, particularly those engaged in manufacturing. This includes encouraging investment and participation agreements in these regions. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to support small businesses in low-income geographic areas, especially those in manufacturing. This involves promoting investment in and participation agreements with these businesses. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to support small businesses in low-income geographic areas, especially those in manufacturing. This involves promoting investment in and participation agreements with these businesses, including small business concerns engaged primarily in manufacturing. The Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to require small business concerns in low-income areas engaged in manufacturing to raise $3,000,000 of private capital from investors meeting specific criteria. Additionally, operational assistance grants under the Act are also amended. The Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to include small business concerns in addition to smaller enterprises in subsections (a)(1) and (b)(1). SEC. 104 of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allow operational assistance for small businesses in low-income areas engaged in manufacturing. This includes support for retooling, updating, or replacing machinery or equipment. SEC. 105 updates the definition of low-income geographic areas. SEC. 105 updates the definition of low-income geographic areas by referencing the definition of 'low-income community' in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. Section 358(a) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to include grants for conditionally approved companies. Companies must repay the grant if they do not receive final approval. Approved companies may have deductions from their grant amount. The Administrator deducts grant amounts from companies receiving final approval for operational assistance. Companies cannot receive more than $50,000 in grants under this paragraph. SEC. 107 amends the time limit for final approval under the Small Business Investment Act. SEC. 108 requires the Administrator to create standard documents for New Markets Venture Capital company applications within 60 days. SEC. 109 eliminates the matching requirement for companies. SEC. 109 eliminates the matching requirement for companies. SEC. 110 simplifies the formula for operational assistance grants. SEC. 111 authorizes appropriations and enhances allocation for small manufacturing. Section 368(a) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. Changes include reducing the guaranteed amount to $100,000,000 and allocating at least 50 percent for companies in low-income areas focused on small business development and manufacturing. Additionally, the amount for paragraph (2) is reduced to $20,000,000. For fiscal years 2010 and 2011, Section 368(a) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to allocate $20,000,000, with at least 50 percent for grants to companies in low-income areas focused on small business development and manufacturing. TITLE II--EXPANDED INVESTMENT IN SMALL BUSINESS RENEWABLE ENERGY

SEC. 201. EXPANDED INVESTMENT IN RENEWABLE ENERGY.

Amends the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to change references from "renewable fuel capital investment" to "renewable energy capital investment."

SEC. 202. RENEWABLE ENERGY CAPITAL INVESTMENT PROGRAM MADE PERMANENT. SEC. 202. Renewable Energy Capital Investment Program made permanent. Amends the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 to remove the pilot designation and section 398. Section 381(1) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958 is amended to include assistance for small businesses to reduce energy consumption or upgrade machinery. Section 383 is amended to require the Administrator to participate in the Renewable Energy Capital Investment Program. A report to Congress on program expansion is due within a year of the Act's enactment. SEC. 206. Simplified fee structure implemented by amending Section 387(a) of the Small Business Investment Act of 1958. SEC. 207. Increased operational assistance grants by amending Section 397(a) to allocate $30,000,000 for fiscal years 2010 and 2011. SEC. 208. Authorizes $1,000,000,000 in guarantees of debentures for each of fiscal years 2010 and 2011.
